Class Pawn

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
pieces.Pawn
public class Pawn extends Piece
Represents a Pawn chess piece. Pawns move forward one square (or two on their first move), capture diagonally, and can perform en passant captures.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jacob Sierra and Robert Zamora

  • Constructor Details

    • Pawn

      public Pawn(String color, Position position)
      Constructs a Pawn with the specified color and position.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the pawn ("white" or "black")
      position - the initial position of the pawn

  • Method Details

    • possibleMoves

      public List<Position> possibleMoves(Piece[][] board)
      Calculates possible moves without considering en passant.
      Specified by:
      possibleMoves in class Piece
      Parameters:
      board - the current board state
      Returns:
      a list of possible destination positions

    • possibleMovesWithEnPassant

      public List<Position> possibleMovesWithEnPassant(Piece[][] board, Position enPassantTarget)
      Calculates all possible moves for this pawn, including en passant. Handles forward movement (one or two squares from starting position), diagonal captures, and en passant captures.
      Parameters:
      board - the current board state
      enPassantTarget - the position where en passant is possible, or null
      Returns:
      a list of all possible destination positions

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this pawn.
      Specified by:
      toString in class Piece
      Returns:
      "wp" for white pawn or "bp" for black pawn
